They are characterized by intense fruity ester, sour, and acidic attributes which only result from spontaneous fermentation. Diacetyl should not be present. Characteristic horsey, goaty, leathery, and phenolic aromas and ﬂavors derived from Brettanomyces yeast are often present at moderate levels. Aged beer is often blended with young beer to create this special style. Vanillin and other wood-derived ﬂavors may range from absent to present at up to low-medium levels. Carbonation can be none (flat) to high.
Contemporary Belgian-Style Spontaneous F.additional_notes: Contemporary Belgian-Style Spontaneous Fermented Ales takes its inspiration from the Traditional Gueuze whose origin is the Brussels area of Belgium. But these beers incorporate specialty malts, spice(s), fruit(s), or many other diverse ingredients and processes that influence the hue, aroma and flavor outcomes of the finished beers such that they differ significantly from traditional examples.

Other Belgian-Style Ale.clarity: Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures
Other Belgian-Style Ale.fermentation_characteristics: Phenolic spiciness may be absent or may be present at low levels. Fruity-ester complexity may range from low to medium, in harmony with malt and other attributes. Diacetyl should not be present.
Other Belgian-Style Ale.additional_notes: Beers in this category recognize the uniqueness and traditions of Belgian brewing, but do not hew to any other Belgian-style categories defined elsewhere in these guidelines. Balance is a key component when assessing these beers. Wood and barrel-aged versions which exhibit sensory attributes of wood-aging are categorized here. Fruited versions are categorized as Belgian-style fruit beers.

Grodziskie.clarity: Some chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures
Grodziskie.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Oak-smoked wheat malt comprises the entire grain bill. Low to medium-low grainy wheat malt character may be present. Smoked wheat malt aromas and flavors are medium-low to medium.
Grodziskie.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Aroma and flavor of noble hops ranges from low to medium-low. Should be slightly lower or equal to intensity of smoke aroma.
Grodziskie.fermentation_characteristics: Very low pear-like fruity esters are acceptable. Very low levels of sulfur are optional. Diacetyl and DMS should not be present. An overall crisp flavor is achieved by managing fermentation temperatures. Sourness should not be present.
Grodziskie.additional_notes: Grodziskie (sometimes referred to as Graetzer in German) is an ale style of Polish origin is low-gravity, light-bodied, wheat ale with a note of oak smoke in aroma and flavor and clean hop bitterness. Historic versions were often bottle conditioned and highly carbonated.

Adambier.clarity: Beer color may be too dark to perceive clarity. When clarity is perceivable, chill haze is absent.
Adambier.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Toast and caramel malt aroma and flavor may be present. Astringency from highly roasted malt should not be present.
Adambier.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Low, with attributes typical of traditional non-hybrid European hop varieties.
Adambier.fermentation_characteristics: A cool ale fermentation is typically used. Extensive aging and acidiﬁcation can mask malt and hop character to varying degrees. Aging in barrels may contribute some level of Brettanomyces and lactic character.
Adambier.additional_notes: The style originated in Dortmund and is a strong, dark, hoppy ale which may or may not be sour. It may also be extensively aged in wooden barrels. Traditional versions may have a low or medium-low degree of smokiness. Adambier may or may not use wheat in its formulation. Smoke character may be absent in contemporary versions. Fruited versions of this style which exhibit attributes of wood-aging should be categorized as fruited Wood- and Barrel-Aged Sour Beers. Fruited versions of this style which do not exhibit attributes of wood-aging should be categorized as Fruit Wheat Beers.

Dutch-Style Kuit, Kuyt or Koyt.clarity: Chill haze and other haze is acceptable
Dutch-Style Kuit, Kuyt or Koyt.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: The aroma is grainy or grainy-bready. A distinctive aroma and flavor profile arises from the use of at least 45 percent oat malt, and at least 20 percent wheat malt. Pale malt makes up the remainder of the grain bill.
Dutch-Style Kuit, Kuyt or Koyt.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Very low to low from noble hops or other traditional European varieties
Dutch-Style Kuit, Kuyt or Koyt.fermentation_characteristics: Esters may be present at low levels. Diacetyl is usually absent in these beers but may be present at very low levels. Acidity and sweet corn-like DMS should not be present.
Dutch-Style Kuit, Kuyt or Koyt.additional_notes: This style of beer was popular in the Netherlands from 1400-1550.

International-Style Pale Ale.clarity: Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures
International-Style Pale Ale.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Very low to medium malt flavor and aroma should be present. Low caramel malt aroma and flavor may be present.
International-Style Pale Ale.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Hop aroma is low to high. Hop ﬂavor is very low to high. Hop character can vary widely, exhibiting diverse hop aroma and flavor attributes.
International-Style Pale Ale.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters are low to high. Diacetyl is usually absent in these beers but may be present at very low levels. DMS should not be present.
International-Style Pale Ale.additional_notes: Pale Ales from around the world may vary considerably from the other pale ale styles defined elsewhere within this document. Pale ales that fit well into other Pale Ale categories (i.e. American, Australian, New Zealand Pale Ale, etc.) should be entered there. Overall impression is a well-integrated, easy drinking, refreshing ale with distinctive hop aroma and flavor attributes including any of floral, herbal, fruity, tropical, pine, or many others. Diacetyl is usually absent in these beers but may be present at very low levels. DMS should not be present.

Classic Australian-Style Pale Ale.clarity: Chill or yeast haze is acceptable at low levels
Classic Australian-Style Pale Ale.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Low malt sweetness and other malt attributes are present
Classic Australian-Style Pale Ale.fermentation_characteristics: Perceivable fruity esters should be present, and are a defining character of this beer style, balanced by low to medium hop aroma. Overall flavor impression is mild. Clean yeasty, bready character may be present. Yeast in suspension if present may impact overall perception of bitterness. Diacetyl is usually absent in these beers but may be present at very low levels. DMS should not be present.
Classic Australian-Style Pale Ale.body: Low to medium with a dry finish

Australian-Style Pale Ale.clarity: Any of yeast, chill, or hop haze may be present in this style at low levels but are not essential
Australian-Style Pale Ale.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Medium-low to medium-high, exhibiting attributes typical of modern hop varieties including any of tropical fruit, mango, passionfruit, or stone fruit
Australian-Style Pale Ale.fermentation_characteristics: Very low to low fruity esters are acceptable but not essential.
Australian-Style Pale Ale.body: Low to medium-low with a dry finish
Australian-Style Pale Ale.additional_notes: Overall impression is a well-integrated easy drinking, refreshing pale ale style with distinctive fruity, tropical, herbal and many other hop aromas and flavours. Diacetyl is usually absent in these beers but may be present at very low levels. DMS should not be present.

New Zealand-Style Pale Ale.clarity: Any of yeast, chill, or hop haze may be present in at low levels but are not essential
New Zealand-Style Pale Ale.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Medium to medium-high, exhibiting attributes including any of tropical fruit, passionfruit, stone fruit, cut grass, or diesel
New Zealand-Style Pale Ale.fermentation_characteristics: Low to medium fruity esters are acceptable but not essential.
New Zealand-Style Pale Ale.body: Medium-low to medium with a dry finish
New Zealand-Style Pale Ale.additional_notes: Overall impression is a well-integrated easy drinking, refreshing pale ale style with distinctive fruity hop aromas and flavors. Diacetyl is absent in these beers. DMS should not be present.

New Zealand-Style India Pale Ale.clarity: Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures. Hop haze is allowable at any temperature.
New Zealand-Style India Pale Ale.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium intensity malt attributes are present in aroma and ﬂavor
New Zealand-Style India Pale Ale.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: High to intense, exhibiting attributes such as ﬂoral, fruity (tropical, stone fruit, and other), sulfur/diesel-like, citrusy, and grassy
New Zealand-Style India Pale Ale.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters are low to high, acceptable but not essential.
New Zealand-Style India Pale Ale.body: Medium-low to medium with a dry finish
New Zealand-Style India Pale Ale.additional_notes: Diacetyl and DMS should not be present. The use of water with high mineral content may result in a crisp, dry beer rather than a malt-accentuated version. Hop attributes are dominant and balanced with malt character.

Finnish-Style Sahti.clarity: Chill haze, yeast haze and general turbidity is acceptable.
Finnish-Style Sahti.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Malt aroma is medium-low to medium. Malt ﬂavor is medium to high with malt sweetness present.
Finnish-Style Sahti.fermentation_characteristics: These beers can vary significantly in character. Fruity ester and yeasty aromas are medium to high. Diacetyl should not be present. Bread/bakers’ yeast is traditionally used for fermentation and may produce flavors and aromas of complex alcohols, clove-like phenolics and banana fruitiness.
Finnish-Style Sahti.additional_notes: Juniper aroma and ﬂavor may or may not be present due to the use of juniper boughs/branches and/or berries in the brewing process.

Swedish-Style Gotlandsdricke.clarity: Chill haze or yeast haze is acceptable
Swedish-Style Gotlandsdricke.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Medium-low to medium. Birchwood smoke character, derived from the malting process, should be present.
Swedish-Style Gotlandsdricke.fermentation_characteristics: Bread/bakers’ yeast is traditionally used for fermentation and contributes to unique character of these beers. Fruity ester and yeasty aromas are medium to high. Diacetyl should not be present.
Swedish-Style Gotlandsdricke.additional_notes: Juniper aroma and flavor should be present due to the use of juniper boughs/branches and berries in the brewing process. These beers are characterized by juniper and birchwood smoked malt.

Breslau-Style Schoeps.clarity: Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures. Hue may be too dark to perceive clarity in some versions.
Breslau-Style Schoeps.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Malt sweetness is medium to medium-high with a pronounced malt character. A high proportion of pale or dark wheat malt (as much as 80 percent) is used to brew these beers as well as Pilsener and other pale, toasted, or dark specialty malts. Paler versions may have bready, aromatic biscuit malt attributes. Darker versions may exhibit roast malt bitterness at low levels, and toasted or nutty malt attributes. Caramel-like malt attributes are not present.
Breslau-Style Schoeps.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters may be present as these beers are fermented with ale yeast as opposed to wheat beer yeast. Diacetyl and phenolic aromas and ﬂavors should not be present.
Breslau-Style Schoeps.additional_notes: Traditional German wheat beer yeast is not used in this style of beer.

Czech-Style Pale Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Unfiltered versions may exhibit slight turbidity.
Czech-Style Pale Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: A slightly sweet and toasted, biscuity, bready malt aroma and ﬂavor is present.
Czech-Style Pale Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Medium-low to medium, derived from late kettle hopping with noble-type hops.
Czech-Style Pale Lager.fermentation_characteristics: The upper limit of original gravity of versions brewed in Czech Republic is 12.99 °Plato or 1.052 specific gravity. Esters are usually not present, but if present should be extremely low, at the limit of perception. Very low levels of diacetyl, if present, are acceptable and may accent malt character. Low levels of sulfur compounds may be present. DMS and acetaldehyde should not be present. Many versions may exhibit flavor contributions typical of decoction mashing.

Vienna-Style Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Vienna-Style Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Characterized by malty aroma and light malt sweetness, which should have a lightly toasted and/or caramel malt character.
Vienna-Style Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Very low to low, derived from noble-type hops.
Vienna-Style Lager.perceived_bitterness: Low to medium-low, clean, and crisp.
Vienna-Style Lager.fermentation_characteristics: DMS, diacetyl, and fruity esters should not be present.

European-Style Dark Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
European-Style Dark Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium with chocolate, roast, and malt aromas and flavors present.
European-Style Dark Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Very low to low with attributes typical of noble-type hops.
European-Style Dark Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters should not be present. In most examples diacetyl should not be present
European-Style Dark Lager.additional_notes: These beers offer a ﬁne balance of sweet maltiness and hop bitterness.

Czech-Style Amber Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Czech-Style Amber Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Medium to medium-high complex malt flavor and aroma with biscuit, cracker, toast and/or light caramel flavors present
Czech-Style Amber Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium with attributes typical of noble-type hops
Czech-Style Amber Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Esters are usually not present, but if present should be extremely low, at the limit of perception Diacetyl may be allowable at low levels
Czech-Style Amber Lager.additional_notes: The upper limit of original gravity of versions brewed in Czech Republic is 14.9 °Plato or 1.060 specific gravity. Very low levels of diacetyl, if present, are acceptable and may accent malt character. Low levels of sulfur compounds may be present. DMS and acetaldehyde should not be present. Many versions may exhibit flavor contributions typical of decoction mashing.

Czech-Style Dark Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Czech-Style Dark Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Medium to medium-high with a slightly sweet rich complex malt character and may include aromas and flavors of crystal malt, bread/toast, caramel/caramel malts, chocolate. Light roast malt character may be present at moderate levels but should not dominate
Czech-Style Dark Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Very low to low with attributes typical of noble-type hops
Czech-Style Dark Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Esters are usually not present, but if present should be extremely low, at the limit of perception. Diacetyl may be allowable at low levels
Czech-Style Dark Lager.additional_notes: The upper limit of original gravity of versions brewed in Czech Republic is 14.99 °Plato or 1.060 specific gravity. Very low levels of diacetyl, if present, are acceptable and may accent malt character. Low levels of sulfur compounds may be present. DMS and acetaldehyde should not be present. Many versions may exhibit flavor contributions typical of decoction mashing

Italian-Style Pilsener.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Italian-Style Pilsener.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: A malty sweet aroma and flavor should be present at low levels. Light biscuity attributes may be present.
Italian-Style Pilsener.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Hop aroma and ﬂavor is pronounced and aromatic, derived from late hopping and dry hopping with noble-type hops. Floral, herbal, peppery, or other attributes may be present.
Italian-Style Pilsener.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity-ester and DMS should not be present. These are well attenuated beers
Italian-Style Pilsener.additional_notes: The head should be dense, pure white, and persistent. Hop character is assertive, crisp and aromatic.

American-Style Lager.clarity: Chill haze should not be present
American-Style Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Malt sweetness is very low to low
American-Style Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters are usually absent, but may be present at very low levels. Diacetyl, acetaldehyde, and DMS should not be present.
American-Style Lager.additional_notes: Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used. American Lagers are very clean and crisp, and aggressively carbonated.

Contemporary American-Style Lager.clarity: Chill haze should not be present
Contemporary American-Style Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Malt sweetness and aroma are very low to low
Contemporary American-Style Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters are usually absent but may be present at very low levels. Diacetyl, acetaldehyde, and DMS should not be present.
Contemporary American-Style Lager.additional_notes: Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used, but all-malt formulations are also made. Contemporary American Lagers typically exhibit increased hop aroma and flavor compared to traditional versions, are clean and crisp, and aggressively carbonated.

American-Style Light Lager.clarity: Chill haze should not be present
American-Style Light Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters are usually absent but may be present at very low levels. Diacetyl, acetaldehyde, and DMS should not be present. These beers are characterized by an extremely high degree of attenuation. Final gravity is often less than 1.000 (0.0 ºPlato).
American-Style Light Lager.additional_notes: Corn, rice or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used. These beers are high in carbonation. Flavor attributes typical of beer are usually very low when present. Calories should not exceed 125 per 12-ounce serving. Low carb beers should have a maximum carbohydrate level of 3.0 gm per 12 oz. (355 ml).

Contemporary American-Style Light Lager.color: Very light to medium amber. The word ‘Light’ refers to light body and reduced calories rather than color.
Contemporary American-Style Light Lager.clarity: Chill haze should not be present
Contemporary American-Style Light Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Low to Medium Low and can exhibit wide range of hop profiles
Contemporary American-Style Light Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters are usually absent but may be present at very low levels. Diacetyl, acetaldehyde, and DMS should not be present. These beers are characterized by an extremely high degree of attenuation. Final gravity is often less than 1.000 (0.0 ºPlato).
Contemporary American-Style Light Lager.body: Low to medium-low, often with dry mouthfeel
Contemporary American-Style Light Lager.additional_notes: Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used but all-malt formulations are also made. These beers are high in carbonation. Hop attributes, though subtle, are more evident than in traditional American-Style Light Lager. Calories should not exceed 125 per 12-ounce serving. Low carb beers should have a maximum carbohydrate level of 3.0 gm per 12 oz. (355 ml)

American-Style Pilsener.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
American-Style Pilsener.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Medium to high, exhibiting attributes typical of noble-type hops
American-Style Pilsener.fermentation_characteristics: DMS, acetaldehyde, fruity esters, and diacetyl should not be present.
American-Style Pilsener.additional_notes: Finish should exhibit low to medium-low body with a clean, crisp malt character evident at low levels. Up to 25% corn or rice in the grist should be used. Beers in this category hew to American-style lagers typical of the pre-Prohibition era.

Contemporary American-Style Pilsener.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Contemporary American-Style Pilsener.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Medium to high. While traditional versions exhibit attributes typical of noble-type hops, contemporary versions will exhibit attributes typical of a wide range of hop varieties.
Contemporary American-Style Pilsener.fermentation_characteristics: DMS, acetaldehyde, fruity esters, and diacetyl should not be present.
Contemporary American-Style Pilsener.additional_notes: All-malt grists are commonly used; up to 25% corn or rice may be incorporated in the grist. Beers in this category diverge from American-style lagers typical of the pre-Prohibition era by virtue of a wide range of hop aroma and flavor attributes.

American-Style India Pale Lager.clarity: Hop haze is allowable. Chill haze should not be present
American-Style India Pale Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Very low to medium, and may exhibit bready, cracker-like, or other attributes typical of pale malts
American-Style India Pale Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: High to very high with attributes typical of hops of any origin
American-Style India Pale Lager.perceived_bitterness: Medium-high to to very high, but not harsh
American-Style India Pale Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters range from absent to medium-low. DMS, acetaldehyde, and diacetyl should not be present.
American-Style India Pale Lager.additional_notes: This style of beer should exhibit the fresh character of hops. Some versions may be brewed with corn, rice, or other adjunct grains, and may exhibit attributes typical of those adjuncts.

American-Style Malt Liquor.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
American-Style Malt Liquor.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and complex alcohol aromas and ﬂavors are acceptable at low levels. Alcohol should not be solvent-like. DMS, diacetyl, and acetaldehyde should not be present.
American-Style Malt Liquor.additional_notes: Beers of this style are varied in character. Some malt liquors are only slightly stronger than American lagers, while others approach bock strength.

American-Style Amber Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
American-Style Amber Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium-low caramel or toasted malt aromas and ﬂavors should be present
American-Style Amber Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present

American-Style Maerzen/Oktoberfest.clarity: Chill haze should not be present
American-Style Maerzen/Oktoberfest.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Sweet maltiness should be present, expressed as a light toasted character. Bready or biscuity malt aroma and ﬂavor is acceptable. Low level caramel attributes are acceptable.
American-Style Maerzen/Oktoberfest.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium-low exhibiting herbal, grass-like, spicy, floral, or citrus attributes
American-Style Maerzen/Oktoberfest.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present
American-Style Maerzen/Oktoberfest.additional_notes: This American version of a classic German beer is distinguished by a more pronounced hop character.

American-Style Dark Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
American-Style Dark Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium malt aroma and ﬂavor may include low levels of caramel, chocolate or roast
American-Style Dark Lager.perceived_bitterness: Very low to medium and dissipates quickly.
American-Style Dark Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters, DMS and diacetyl should not be present.

Mexican-Style Light Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear; Chill haze should not be present
Mexican-Style Light Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium-low pale malt sweetness and aroma may be present. May have adjunct flavors from corn and/or rice
Mexican-Style Light Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Very low to low with attributes typical of noble-type hops
Mexican-Style Light Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Clean fermentation profile; low fruity esters may be present; sulfur may be present in very low levels. Diacetyl should not be present
Mexican-Style Light Lager.body: Very light to light body with dry finish
Mexican-Style Light Lager.additional_notes: Clean pale lagers often made with 2-row pilsner malt and may contain corn and/or rice to lighten body. Medium to medium-high carbonation and low final gravity produce a light-bodied beer that finishes dry

Mexican-Style Pale Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear; Chill haze should not be present
Mexican-Style Pale Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium-low pale malt sweetness and aroma may be present. May have adjunct flavors and aromas from corn and/or rice
Mexican-Style Pale Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Low with attributes typical of noble-type hops
Mexican-Style Pale Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Clean fermentation profile; low fruity esters may be present; sulfur may be present in very low levels. Diacetyl should not be present
Mexican-Style Pale Lager.body: Low to medium-low with dry finish
Mexican-Style Pale Lager.additional_notes: Clean pale lagers often made with 2-row pilsner malt and may contain corn and/or rice to lighten body. Head retention may be medium to medium low and low noble-hop character is slightly more noticeable than that of its light counterpart

Mexican-Style Amber Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear with white head of foam; Chill haze should not be present
Mexican-Style Amber Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Medium-low to medium-high caramel and bready malt aroma and flavor; light roast and light corn and/or rice flavors may be present
Mexican-Style Amber Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: None to low with attributes typical of noble-type hops
Mexican-Style Amber Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Clean fermentation profile; low fruity esters may be present; sulfur may be present in very low levels. Diacetyl should not be present
Mexican-Style Amber Lager.body: Light to medium-light body with light creaminess
Mexican-Style Amber Lager.additional_notes: Addition of specialty malts may provide caramel or lightly toasted complexity to malt profile. The presence of corn and/or rice to lighten body may be noticeable. Medium to medium-high carbonation with dry finish makes these beers very refreshing

Mexican-Style Dark Lager.color: Dark copper to dark brown with ruby or garnet highlights
Mexican-Style Dark Lager.clarity: Appearance should be clear with creamy, beige to light brown foam. Chill haze should not be present
Mexican-Style Dark Lager.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Medium to medium high complex bready toast malt aroma and sweetness from addition of darker specialty malts; light caramel, toast, nutty and/or toffee flavors may be present; Low aromas and flavors from corn and/or rice may be present
Mexican-Style Dark Lager.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: None to low with attributes typical of noble-type hops
Mexican-Style Dark Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Clean fermentation profile; low fruity esters may be present; sulfur may be present in very low levels. Diacetyl should not be present
Mexican-Style Dark Lager.body: Medium to medium-full body with dry finish
Mexican-Style Dark Lager.additional_notes: Grain bill may contain Munich and/or Vienna type base malts. May also contain corn and/or rice. Small amounts of toasted and crystal malts and/or dextrin may be added for color and slight sweetness.

West Coast-Style Pilsener.clarity: Hop haze or chill haze is allowable at low levels
West Coast-Style Pilsener.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium. May include pilsner malt attributes such as bready, toasty, or cracker-like
West Coast-Style Pilsener.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Medium-high to very high, exhibiting a wide range of attributes including floral, piney, citrus, fruity (berry, tropical, stone fruit, and other), sulfur, dank, diesel-like, catty, resinous, and many others
West Coast-Style Pilsener.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters range from absent to medium-low; DMS, acetaldehyde, and diacetyl should not be present. Light sulfur character that enhances hop expression is allowable
West Coast-Style Pilsener.body: Low to medium. In balance to support high dry hop rates
West Coast-Style Pilsener.additional_notes: This style of beer should balance the fresh, assertive expression of Pacific Northwest and Southern Hemisphere hops with the drinkability found in a Pilsner. Kettle hops can be either European/noble-type hops or modern IPA hops, though the pronounced hop expression showcases modern IPA hops. Crispness and drinkability are at the forefront of the style, but body and structure are needed to balance a significant dry hop load. Beers dry hopped with European/noble-type hops should be classified as Italian-Style Pilsner

International Light Lager.clarity: Chill haze should not be present
International Light Lager.fermentation_characteristics: Sugar adjuncts are often used to lighten the body and ﬂavor, sometimes contributing to very low to low fruity esters such as apple or pear. DMS, diacetyl, and acetaldehyde should not be present.
International Light Lager.additional_notes: Sugar, corn, rice, and other cereal grains or carbohydrates sources are used as adjuncts.

International-Style Pilsener.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
International-Style Pilsener.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: A malty sweet aroma and flavor may be present at low levels, along with adjunct flavors from corn, rice, wheat or other grains.
International-Style Pilsener.fermentation_characteristics: Very low levels of DMS aroma and ﬂavor are acceptable. Fruity esters and isoamyl acetate may be allowable in minimal levels (at the edge of perception). Acetaldehyde, and diacetyl should not be present.
International-Style Pilsener.additional_notes: These beers are often brewed with rice, corn, wheat, or other grains and may exhibit flavor profiles of those specific adjuncts used. Sugar adjuncts may also be used.

Baltic-Style Porter.clarity: Opaque. When clarity is perceivable, chill haze should not be present.
Baltic-Style Porter.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Malt sweetness is medium-low to medium-high. Distinctive malt aromas and flavors of caramelized sugars, dark sugars, and dried fruits are present. Roast malt attributes may be present at low levels, but any bitterness or astringency should be in harmony with other flavor aspects.
Baltic-Style Porter.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Very low. Floral hop aroma can complement aromatics.
Baltic-Style Porter.fermentation_characteristics: Due to its alcoholic strength, there may be very low to low levels of complex alcohol aromas and ﬂavors, and higher levels of fruitiness suggestive of berries, grapes, or plums, but not banana. Fruity esters, DMS, and diacetyl should not be present.
Baltic-Style Porter.additional_notes: Baltic Porter is brewed with lager yeast and fermented and lagered cold producing a smooth beer. A low level of oxidation, if harmonious with other flavor components, is acceptable.

German-Style Leichtbier.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
German-Style Leichtbier.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present. Very low levels of sulfur-related compounds are acceptable.

German-Style Pilsener.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
German-Style Pilsener.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: A malty sweet aroma and flavor should be present at low levels. Light biscuity attributes may be present.
German-Style Pilsener.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Hop aroma and ﬂavor is moderate and pronounced, derived from late hopping (not dry hopping) with noble-type hops. Floral, herbal, peppery, or other attributes may be present.
German-Style Pilsener.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity-ester and DMS should not be present. These are well attenuated beers.
German-Style Pilsener.additional_notes: The head should be dense, pure white, and persistent. Hop character is assertive and crisp.

Munich-Style Helles.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Munich-Style Helles.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Malt aroma and ﬂavor are pronounced. Low levels of yeast-produced sulfur aromas and ﬂavors may be present. Malt character may contain light biscuit attributes. There should be no caramel character.
Munich-Style Helles.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Hop aroma is not present to low. Hop ﬂavor is very low to low, derived from noble-type hops.
Munich-Style Helles.perceived_bitterness: Low, derived from European noble-type hops.
Munich-Style Helles.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present. A very low level of DMS and/or sulfur attributes may be present (but not required) and in balance with other attributes.
Munich-Style Helles.additional_notes: Many beer brands known as Austrian-Style Maerzen are nearly indistinguishable from Munich-Style Helles and are appropriately categorized here.

Dortmunder/European-Style Export.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Dortmunder/European-Style Export.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Sweet malt character should be low and should not be caramelly
Dortmunder/European-Style Export.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Very low to low, derived from noble-type hops.
Dortmunder/European-Style Export.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present.
Dortmunder/European-Style Export.additional_notes: Traditionally, German-style Export beers were brewed to higher gravity/higher alcohol than domestic beers to promote longer shelf-life in export markets.

Franconian-Style Rotbier.clarity: Clear to slightly hazy for unfiltered versions. Chill haze should not be present.
Franconian-Style Rotbier.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Characterized by malty aroma and light malt sweetness, which should have a lightly toasted and/or caramel malt character.
Franconian-Style Rotbier.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium-low, with attributes typical of noble-type hops.
Franconian-Style Rotbier.perceived_bitterness: Low to medium-low, producing a clean finish.
Franconian-Style Rotbier.fermentation_characteristics: DMS, diacetyl, fruity esters, and phenolic attributes should not be present.

German-Style Maerzen.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
German-Style Maerzen.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Bready or biscuity malt aroma and flavor should be present. Sweet maltiness is medium-low to medium and leads to a muted clean hop bitterness. Malt ﬂavors should be of light toast rather than strong caramel. Low level caramel character is acceptable.
German-Style Maerzen.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Low with attributes typical of noble hop varieties
German-Style Maerzen.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present

German-Style Oktoberfest/Festbier.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
German-Style Oktoberfest/Festbier.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Clean, sweet, bready malt profile is low to medium-low
German-Style Oktoberfest/Festbier.perceived_bitterness: Very low to low and in balance with low sweet maltiness
German-Style Oktoberfest/Festbier.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present
German-Style Oktoberfest/Festbier.additional_notes: In Germany, Oktoberfest beer is required to be at least 13.5° Plato

Munich-Style Dunkel.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Munich-Style Dunkel.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Malt character is low to medium, with chocolate, roast, bread, or biscuit aromas and flavors contributed by using dark Munich malt or other specialty malts.
Munich-Style Dunkel.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Very low to low, with attributes typical of noble-type hops.
Munich-Style Dunkel.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present
Munich-Style Dunkel.additional_notes: Dunkels do not offer an overly sweet impression, but rather a balance between malt and dark malt sweetness and hop character.

German-Style Schwarzbier.color: Very dark brown to black, with a pale-colored head.
German-Style Schwarzbier.clarity: Beer color may be too dark to perceive. When clarity is perceivable, chill haze should not be present.
German-Style Schwarzbier.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Medium malt aroma displays a mild roasted malt character. Malt sweetness is low to medium and displays a mild roasted malt character without bitterness.
German-Style Schwarzbier.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Hop aroma and ﬂavor is very low to low, derived from noble-type hops.
German-Style Schwarzbier.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present.

Bamberg-Style Helles Rauchbier.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Bamberg-Style Helles Rauchbier.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Malt character is prominent with malt aromas suggesting lightly toasted sweet, malted barley. Smoke beechwood character ranges from very low to medium. Smoky aroma should be not harshly phenolic. Sulfur may be present at low levels. There should be no caramel character. Smoke ﬂavor may create a perception of mild sweetness.
Bamberg-Style Helles Rauchbier.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Hop aroma and ﬂavor is very low to low, derived from noble-type hops.
Bamberg-Style Helles Rauchbier.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present. Very low levels of sulfur-related compounds are acceptable.

Bamberg-Style Maerzen Rauchbier.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Bamberg-Style Maerzen Rauchbier.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Sweet toasted malt aroma should be present. Medium-low to medium toasted malt sweetness should be present. Aroma and flavor of smoked beechwood ranges from very low to medium. Smoke ﬂavors should be smooth, without harshness. Aroma should strike a balance between malt, hop, and smoke.
Bamberg-Style Maerzen Rauchbier.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Hop aroma and ﬂavor is very low to low, derived from noble-type hops.
Bamberg-Style Maerzen Rauchbier.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be present

Bamberg-Style Bock Rauchbier.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Bamberg-Style Bock Rauchbier.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Medium to medium-high malt aroma and ﬂavor should be present with very low to medium-high beechwood smoke aromas and ﬂavors. Smoke flavors should be smooth, without harshness. Smoke ﬂavor may create a perception of mild sweetness.
Bamberg-Style Bock Rauchbier.perceived_bitterness: Medium, increasing proportionately with starting gravity.
Bamberg-Style Bock Rauchbier.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters are usually absent, but if present should be very low. Diacetyl should not be present.

German-Style Heller Bock/Maibock.color: Pale to light amber. The German word ‘helle’ means light-colored, thus Heller Bock is a pale beer.
German-Style Heller Bock/Maibock.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
German-Style Heller Bock/Maibock.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Light toasty or bready aroma and flavor attributes are often present. Roast or heavy toast/caramel malt aromas and ﬂavors should not be present.
German-Style Heller Bock/Maibock.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Low to medium-low, derived from noble-type hops.
German-Style Heller Bock/Maibock.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters, if present, should be low. Diacetyl should not be present.

Traditional German-Style Bock.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
Traditional German-Style Bock.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Traditional Bocks are made with all malt and have high malt character with aromas of toasted or nutty malt, but not caramel. Traditional bocks display high malt sweetness. The malt ﬂavor profile should display a balance of sweetness and toasted or nutty malt, but not caramel.
Traditional German-Style Bock.perceived_bitterness: Medium, increasing proportionately with starting gravity.
Traditional German-Style Bock.fermentation_characteristics: Fruity esters if present should be minimal. Diacetyl should not be present.

German-Style Doppelbock.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
German-Style Doppelbock.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Pronounced aromas and flavors of toasted malted barley. Some caramel and toffee character can contribute to complexity in a secondary role. Dark fruit flavors such as prune and raisin may be present. Malty sweetness is pronounced but should not be cloying. There should be no astringency from roasted malts.
German-Style Doppelbock.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Hop aroma is absent. Hop ﬂavor is low.
German-Style Doppelbock.fermentation_characteristics: Alcoholic strength is high. Fruity esters are commonly perceived at low to moderate levels. Diacetyl should not be present.

German-Style Eisbock.clarity: Appearance should be clear. Chill haze should not be present
German-Style Eisbock.perceived_malt_aroma_and_flavor: Sweet malt character is very high. Dark fruit flavors such as prune and raisin may be present
German-Style Eisbock.perceived_hop_aroma_and_flavor: Hop aroma and ﬂavor is absent
German-Style Eisbock.fermentation_characteristics: Alcohol may be present in aroma. Fruity esters may be evident, but not overpowering. Diacetyl should not be present. Alcoholic strength is very high.
German-Style Eisbock.additional_notes: This is a stronger version of Doppelbock. Traditionally, these beers were created by freezing a Doppelbock and removing the ice, thus concentrating the alcohol.
